page.title: 09Parkend Friendly Circle
page.content: This is a club for the over 60s run under the W.R.V.S. it was formed in 1971 and meets fortnightly.Meetings may be just an informal chat over tea and biscuits and other times a speaker is invited.This year members have had day trips to Stafford -On-Avon and Weston-Super-Mare, an afternoon with tea and entertainment arranged by the county W.R.V.S.,whilst some joined with another club to spend a holiday in Jersey.A harvest servise and sale is held annually when other clubs are invited .Members enjoy a Christmas Lunch each year.Blankets and jerseys have been knitted and crotcheted for the Ethiopian Famine Appeal and soft toys for the Christmas parcels for the privileged children made together with dolls renovated and dressed.It is hoped this year to hold a small exhibition of work done by members.
